'''''Sindarin Lexicon''''' by Kenneth Chaij is a [[Sindarin]] dictionary which also includes the articles "A History of the Sindarin Language", "Sindarin Pronunciation" and "English in Fëanorean" by David Masson. The book was published by [[The Tolkien Society]] in [[2001]] under the auspices of the [[Peter Roe Memorial Fund]]. 

==Summary==
{{blockquote|This work lists the words in Sindarin found in 23 books by J R R Tolkien. It gives their English equivalents and the books in which they occur. Words are included from the Sindarin dialects of Mithrim, Nagathrond, Gondolin, the Falathrim, Doriath and the people of the Sons of Feanor. The book also contains a short history of Sindarin and a guide to pronunciation. Finally there is a guide to writing English using elvish (Feanorean) characters.}}

==Contents==
* Introduction
* Foreword
* Preface
* A History of the Sindarin Language
* Sindarin Pronunciation
** Stress
** Consonants
** Vowels
** Diphthongs
** Simple Phrases
* Sindarin - English Lexicon
** Notes
* English in Fëanorean
** Transliteration System
** Specimen Passages
** Other Languages
